Henry Carpio

(347) 296-5416 · carpiohenry20@gmail.com

As a current CSCI student at John Jay, I joined the TTP Residency to gain hands-on experience as a developer. While there (the TTP Residency) I learned FSW development utilizing both front-end and back end technologies, such as JavaScript, Node.js, Bootstrap, Postgres, React, and MongoDB. I had the opportunity to work in groups of 5 to build a website using Git and GitHub for version control. We also used slack for communicating. Currently, I am building on what I learned during my time at TTP to create a personal portfolio website, and my own photography website. Programming has become more than just a major for me, it has taught me to think logically in order to solve problems and analyze algorithms, as well as has forced me to quickly adapt to an ever-changing environment. After my experience in web development at the TTP, I am hopeful that over the following years I will continue to intern at a variety of companies/institutions.
